abstract: An order of Cistercian monks have rebuilt a 12th-century chapter house whose stones lay for decades after being brought from Europe by William Randolph Hearst in the 1930s.
snippet: An order of Cistercian monks have rebuilt a 12th-century chapter house whose stones lay for decades after being brought from Europe by William Randolph Hearst in the 1930s.
lead_paragraph: VINA, Calif. — The rebirth of a medieval Cistercian monastery building here on a patch of rural Northern California land was, of course, improbable. William Randolph Hearst, the newspaper tycoon, brought the dismantled Santa Maria de Óvila monastery from Spain but failed to restore it. The City of San Francisco, after some fitful starts at bringing the monastery back to life, left its stones languishing for decades in Golden Gate Park. The Great Depression, World War II and lethargy got in the way.

snippet: President Obama’s nominee for secretary of defense, Chuck Hagel, is appearing before the Senate Armed Services Committee Thursday morning.
lead_paragraph: President Obama’s nominee for secretary of defense, Chuck Hagel, appeared before the Senate Armed Services Committee Thursday morning for a combative confirmation hearing focusing on Iran, Israel and the American military’s role in the world. White House officials say they remain confident about his prospects.

headline.main: Video of the Hagel’s Opening Statement

abstract: The order from the judge, Col. James L. Pohl of the Army, followed a mysterious interruption on Monday of a feed from the military tribunal courtroom in Guantánamo Bay.
snippet: The order from the judge, Col. James L. Pohl of the Army, followed a mysterious interruption on Monday of a feed from the military tribunal courtroom in Guantánamo Bay.
lead_paragraph: FORT MEADE, Md. — The military judge overseeing the prosecution of Khalid Shaikh Mohammed and four other detainees accused of aiding the Sept. 11 terrorist attacks ordered the government on Thursday to disconnect the technology that allows offstage censors — apparently including the Central Intelligence Agency — to block a public feed of the courtroom proceedings at Guantánamo Bay, Cuba.

headline.main: Judge Stops Censorship in Sept. 11 Case
headline.print_headline: Judge Stops Censorship in Sept. 11 Case

abstract: The Republican National Committee, which started the 2012 campaign cycle deeply in financial distress, will begin the current period without any debt and with $4.7 million in cash on hand.

lead_paragraph: The Republican National Committee, which started the 2012 campaign cycle in deep financial distress, will begin the current period without any debt and with $4.7 million in cash on hand.

headline.main: Republican Committee Begins Midterm Election Cycle in the Black

abstract: A belief that the politics of immigration has firmly shifted in the president’s direction is fueling his push for quick action and broad changes.
snippet: A belief that the politics of immigration has firmly shifted in the president’s direction is fueling his push for quick action and broad changes.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As the specifics of immigration legislation take shape on Capitol Hill, President Obama is making it clear that he wants the overhaul on his terms.

headline.main: On Immigration, Obama Assumes Upper Hand
headline.print_headline: On Immigration, Obama Assumes Upper Hand

abstract: In an emotional farewell, Senator John Kerry rejected the notion that the Senate was broken and encouraged lawmakers to build relationships to advance American interests at home and abroad.
snippet: In an emotional farewell, Senator John Kerry rejected the notion that the Senate was broken and encouraged lawmakers to build relationships to advance American interests at home and abroad.
lead_paragraph: Senator John Kerry of Massachusetts bade a long and emotional farewell to the Senate  on Wednesday, as he prepared to leave it after 28 years to become the secretary of state.

headline.main: Kerry Says Goodbye to the Senate

abstract: The defendants were among those named in a Philadelphia grand jury report on sexual abuse.
snippet: The defendants were among those named in a Philadelphia grand jury report on sexual abuse.
lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA — A Roman Catholic priest and a former Catholic school teacher were convicted on Wednesday on nine charges relating to the sexual abuse of a 10-year-old boy at different times more than a decade ago.

headline.main: Ex-Teacher and a Priest Are Convicted in Abuse Case
headline.print_headline: Ex-Teacher And a Priest Are Convicted In Abuse Case

lead_paragraph: One way to think of the Republican candidate for governor of Virginia is as Son of Santorum.

abstract: Arthur Harmon, 70, suspected of killing one person and wounding two others in a shooting at an office complex, apparently killed himself.
snippet: Arthur Harmon, 70, suspected of killing one person and wounding two others in a shooting at an office complex, apparently killed himself.
lead_paragraph: PHOENIX — A man who opened fire at an office complex here was found dead on Thursday from a self-inflicted gunshot wound in the nearby city of Mesa, the police said. One of his victims, a lawyer, was placed on life support and “will not survive,” according to a statement from the firm where he worked.

headline.main: Man Suspected in Phoenix Shooting Is Found Dead
headline.print_headline: Arizona: Man Suspected in Shooting Is Found Dead

abstract: In deciding whether an employer’s health plan is affordable, the Internal Revenue Service said it would look at the cost of coverage only for an individual, not for a family.
snippet: In deciding whether an employer’s health plan is affordable, the Internal Revenue Service said it would look at the cost of coverage only for an individual, not for a family.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Obama administration adopted a strict definition of affordable health insurance on Wednesday that will deny federal financial assistance to millions of Americans with modest incomes who cannot afford family coverage offered by employers.

headline.main: Federal Rule Limits Aid to Families Who Can’t Afford Employers’ Health Coverage
headline.print_headline: Federal Rule Limits Aid to Families Who Can’t Afford Employers’ Health Coverage

abstract: On Thursday, John W. Warner and Sam Nunn returned to the Senate Armed Services Committee room to urge the confirmation of Chuck Hagel as defense secretary, almost 25 years after they battled over the nomination of John G. Tower.
snippet: On Thursday, John W. Warner and Sam Nunn returned to the Senate Armed Services Committee room to urge the confirmation of Chuck Hagel as defense secretary, almost 25 years after they battled over the nomination of John G. Tower.
lead_paragraph: It has been nearly a quarter of a century since the Southern drawls of Senators Sam Nunn and John W. Warner echoed through a Senate hearing room as an embattled defense secretary nominee fought for his job.

headline.main: In Nunn and Warner, a Reminder of the Tower Hearings
